name: papoose
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device like a bag for carrying a baby, tied to the front or the back of an adult's body: She had a three-year-old child by the hand, and a baby in a papoose.
Patrycia Schweiß/EyeEm/GettyImages
old-fashioned offensive a Native American baby or small child
More examplesFewer examplesHe had with him a baby carried in a papoose.With your baby clipped to your chest in a papoose, you go shopping as normally as possible.Some protesters brought their children tucked into colourful papooses.They bought a very expensive sheepskin papoose for their baby.Sioux Indians travelled through with squaws and papooses.
